data.enText: serious and very important; affecting the most central and important parts of sth

data.chText: 这两个观点有根本区别。
data.enText: There is a fundamental difference between the two points of view.

data.chText: 公共医疗在组织上需要有一个根本性的变革。
data.enText: A fundamental change in the organization of health services was required.
central; forming the necessary basis of sth

data.chText: 勤奋工作是成功的基础。
data.enText: Hard work is fundamental to success.
forming the source or base from which everything else is made; not able to be divided any further

data.chText: 基本规律；根本法则；基本原理；基础
data.enText: a basic rule or principle; an essential part

data.chText: 现代物理学的基本原理
他教给了我这工作的基本知识。
data.enText: He taught me the fundamentals of the job.

ex.chText: 那位律师连最基本的事实都不知道。
ex.enText: The lawyer was ignorant of even the most elementary facts.

ex.chText: 送他们到私立小学或许比较好。
ex.enText: It might be better to send them to a private elementary school.

ex.chText: 这里指的是从简单阅读和基本技能开始的基础教育。
ex.enText: Here it refers to elementary education, starting with simple reading and basic skills.

synonyms.bx: 强调基本的、简单的，或指事物处于初级阶段的，通常作定语。

ex.chText: 爱和恨是人类最基本的两种情感。
ex.enText: Love and hatred are two of the most elemental human emotions.

synonyms.bx: 指作为事物的基础或本质的，通常作定语。

ex.chText: 在任何情况下，基本原理保持不变。
ex.enText: In all cases, the fundamental principles remain the same.

ex.chText: 你我的政治信仰根本不同。
ex.enText: There are fundamental differences between your political beliefs and mine.

synonyms.bx: 指反映事物本质的，强调重要性。

ex.chText: 我们首先要关心的必须是儿童。
ex.enText: Our primary concern must be the children.

ex.chText: 良好的医疗保健是重中之重。
ex.enText: Good health care is of primary importance.

synonyms.bx: 指在重要性方面占据首位的，通常作定语。

synonym.guide: 导航词义：初级的，基本的

tr: the lowest tone of a harmonic series
any factor that could be considered important to the understanding of a particular business
example: fundamentals include a company's growth, revenues, earnings, management, and capital structure
the central cause of the problem
an example that was fundamental to the argument
computers are fundamental to modern industrial structure

tr: being or involving basic facts or principles
example: the fundamental laws of the universe

tr: far-reaching and thoroughgoing in effect especially on the nature of something
example: the fundamental revolution in human values that has occurred
committed the fundamental error of confusing spending with extravagance

value.def: You use fundamental to describe things, activities, and principles that are very important or essential. They affect the basic nature of other things or are the most important element upon which other things depend.

example.ex: Our constitution embodies all the fundamental principles of democracy...
example.tran: 我们的宪法体现了民主的所有基本原则。

example.ex: A fundamental human right is being withheld from these people...
example.tran: 这些人被剥夺了一项最基本的人权。

example.ex: Technical skill is a fundamental basis for most, if not all, great art.
example.tran: 技巧即使不是所有伟大艺术、也是其中大多数的根本基础。

value.tran: 基本的;根本的;主要的;基础的

value.def: You use fundamental to describe something which exists at a deep and basic level, and is therefore likely to continue.

example.ex: But on this question, the two leaders have very fundamental differences...
example.tran: 但在这个问题上，两位领导人有着根本性的分歧。

example.ex: Amnesty says there are fundamental flaws in their military justice system.
example.tran: 国际特赦组织称他们的军事司法体系存在着根本性的缺陷。

value.tran: 根本性的;固有的;根深蒂固的

value.def: If one thing is fundamental to another, it is absolutely necessary to it, and the second thing cannot exist, succeed, or be imagined without it.

example.ex: He believes better relations with China are fundamental to the well-being of the area...
example.tran: 他相信和中国建立更加良好的关系对这一地区的繁荣发展至关重要。

example.ex: The method they pioneered remains fundamental to research into the behaviour of nerve cells.
example.tran: 他们首创的方法在神经细胞活动的研究中一直是不可或缺的。

value.def: You can use fundamental to show that you are referring to what you consider to be the most important aspect of a situation, and that you are not concerned with less important details.

example.ex: The fundamental problem lies in their inability to distinguish between reality and invention...
example.tran: 最根本的问题在于他们无法分清现实和虚构。

example.ex: It was not simply a practical matter, but a fundamental question of principle.
example.tran: 那不仅仅是个实际问题，更是一个根本性的原则问题。

value.def: Fundamental research into a subject is concerned with gaining knowledge about the subject itself, rather than its practical aspects.

example.ex: Industry leaders want scientists to engage in fundamental research, not applied research.
example.tran: 行业领袖希望科学家从事基础性研究，而非应用性研究。

trans: 基本力(宇宙万物所具有的特性，包括引力和电磁力等四种)
